content: Some of the backup files are not supported. Click "Check unsupported files" to download the list of the unsupported items

comment.text: The "UnsupportedFilesDescription" translation key is used to display a message when certain backup files are not supported, indicating that users can click on "Check unsupported files" to download a list of unsupported items. This message appears in a UI element and provides context for users to understand the issue with their files.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a colon after 'dəstəklənmir', which is not common in this context. It's more natural to follow with a comma or no punctuation at all.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bəzi ehtiyat faylları dəstəklənmir, Dəstəklənməyən elementlərin siyahısını endirmək üçün...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation uses quotation marks (``) for 'Check unsupported files'. The English uses double quotes ("). It's important to maintain consistent formatting for UI elements. While not strictly incorrect, adhering to standard double quotes is preferred for consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `` with " in the Czech translation: "Některé záložní soubory nejsou podporovány. Kliknutím na "Zkontrolovat nepodporované soubory" stáhnete seznam nepodporovaných položek."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Check unsupported files" is translated as "Verificar archivos no compatibles". While technically correct, it might be more natural to use a phrase like "Mostrar archivos no compatibles" or "Consultar archivos no compatibles" to better align with common user interface language. "Verificar" implies a verification action, while the original English implies viewing a list.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "Mostrar archivos no compatibles" or "Consultar archivos no compatibles" instead of "Verificar archivos no compatibles"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Vérifiez les fichiers non pris en charge" could be improved for clarity.  It's a bit clunky.  While technically correct, it reads less naturally.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Click on "Afficher la liste des fichiers non pris en charge" (Display the list of unsupported files)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon after "չեն աջակցվում" feels slightly abrupt. A more natural flow might involve a connecting word or phrase.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider adding a conjunction like 'և' (and) or a phrase like 'այնպես, որ' (so that) after 'չեն աջակցվում' to improve readability. For example: "Պահուստային ֆայլերից մի քանիսը չեն աջակցվում, և Սեղմեք..." or "Պահուստային ֆայլերից մի քանիսը չեն աջակցվում, այնպես, որ Սեղմեք..."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Check unsupported files" is translated as "Verifica file non supportati". While technically correct, "Verifica" implies a verification action performed *by the system*. The intended meaning is to *view* the list. A more appropriate translation would be something like "Visualizza file non supportati" or "Elenco file non supportati".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Visualizza file non supportati

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation uses a polite request style ("ください") which might be overly formal for a user interface element. Consider a more direct imperative or a slightly softened request.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 一部のバックアップファイルはサポートされていません。「サポートされていないファイルの確認」をクリックして、サポートされていない項目のリストをダウンロードできます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a lowercase 'p' in 'Pārbaudīt', while button names are typically capitalized.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pārbaudīt

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Dutch translation preserves the button text "Controleer niet-ondersteunde bestanden" exactly as it appears in English. While technically correct, it might benefit from a more natural phrasing in Dutch, especially considering the previous sentence uses a slightly different wording. It could be more user-friendly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing the button text to something like "Bekijk niet-ondersteunde bestanden" or "Toon niet-ondersteunde bestanden" for better flow with the rest of the message.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Verificar arquivos não suportados" (Check unsupported files) should match the original English phrase's capitalization. It should be "Verificar arquivos não suportados"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verificar arquivos não suportados

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Verificarea fișierelor care nu sunt acceptate" is a literal translation of "Check unsupported files" and is not the most natural Romanian phrasing. It sounds clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more idiomatic translation like "Verificați fișierele neacceptate" or "Consultați lista fișierelor neacceptate".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translated text uses a capitalized "Verificarea" which doesn't align with the English source where the button label 'Check unsupported files' is title case.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change "Verificarea" to "Verificați" to match the button label capitalization.  Alternatively, if the button text is to be changed to be title case, change the English text first.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The button text "Проверьте неподдерживаемые файлы" is not an exact match to the English "Check unsupported files". While the meaning is similar, maintaining consistency is important for UI clarity. A more literal translation would be "Проверить неподдерживаемые файлы".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Проверить неподдерживаемые файлы

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase »Preveri nepodprte datoteke« is enclosed in right-pointing double quotes (»), which is not standard Slovenian formatting for button labels or links.  It should typically be in single quotes or no quotes at all.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Preveri nepodprte datoteke or 'Preveri nepodprte datoteke'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'датотека' (datoteka) is technically correct for 'file', but 'фајл' (fajl) is more commonly used and natural-sounding in modern Serbian (especially in a technical context).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'датотека' with 'фајл'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a formal tone ("Desteklenmeyen öğelerin listesini indirmek için") which doesn't match the friendly tone of the English version ("Click "Check unsupported files"").
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more conversational tone, such as "Desteklenmeyen dosyaları kontrol et" seçeneğine tıklayarak listeyi indirebilirsiniz.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: "Unsupported files" is translated as "Desteklenmeyen dosyaları", which is accurate but might benefit from clarification depending on the target audience. While accurate, using just "desteklenmeyen dosyalar" might not be immediately clear to all users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a slight rephrase, such as "Desteklenmeyen yedekleme dosyalarını kontrol et" or "Uyumsuz yedekleme dosyalarını kontrol et" for greater clarity.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation uses angled brackets « » for the button label, which isn't standard Ukrainian or UI practice. Double quotes "" or regular parentheses () are more common.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace «Перевірити непідтримувані файли» with "Перевірити непідтримувані файли" or (Перевірити непідтримувані файли)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "不支持的项目列表" is a slightly unnatural way to say "list of unsupported items." It literally translates to "list of unsupported items," but doesn't flow as naturally in Chinese. A better phrasing would better reflect the original English meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 您可以点击“检查不支持的文件”，下载不支持的文件列表

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The quotation marks around “检查不支持的文件” might not be the standard or preferred style for this context. Check for consistency with other UI elements.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure quotation mark style aligns with existing UI conventions.
